title: Mission Description
content: Why would a father sacrifice his daughter? Why would a daughter slay her mother? Why do gods torment mortals? Why would an eagle cast a tortoise shell upon a poet's head?In countless poems of the wine god, people rage, grieve, and despair. It was because the roots of these tragedies are elusive and impassive, beyond the reach of blade or noose. Just as sailors cannot slay the sea.

text: Come, seek the song on the shore that bears no fruits.
Listen to the whispers of the tides, for they sing—
"Among the distant cliffs, I see Helektra."
Watch how that Chalice of Plenty shatters to pieces
Follow the trail of honey brew, salt water and blood, keep searching for the song.

title: Step Description
content: O ship, the waves are pushing you back to sea.What now? Firmly stop. Turn toward the harbor!Can't you see? The oars are gone from your sides. The mast has snapped in the fierce southwest wind. The rigging groans with sorrow. No ropes remain. How will your hull survive the crashing waves? The sails are torn, and the divine statue has vanished.— Beware. Do not let the storm toy with you.

text: Swim along the salty, rust-flavored currents
Let the river blocked by time flow freely
Listen to the lament of the tides, for they sing—
"Oh please, spare me! God of Wine, have mercy!"
Piece together all that was shattered, just as she once did
Go chase the herds in the water, go gaze upon the mountain peaks

title: Step Description
content: Where are the fish? Among green weeds, nodding heads in gentle streams. Where is the king? In capital bright, wine brings joy and pure delight.Where are the fish? In waters deep, long tails sway in graceful sweep. Where is the king? In capital grand, feasting peaceful through the land.Where are the fish? By cattails serene, resting calm in waters green. Where is the king? In capital's halls, dwelling where tranquility calls.

text: Go sing a song for the sun sitting on the mountain—
"Spare your heart the splendor of triumphs."
"Please stay with us, long and in joy."
"Do not return yet to the heavens, just a little longer."
The drunken dream is over, sink to the bottom of the sea
Try to repair the broken path ahead

title: Step Description
content: O ship, the waves are pushing you back to sea.What now? Firmly stop. Turn toward the harbor!Can't you see? The oars are gone from your sides. The mast has snapped in the fierce southwest wind. The rigging groans with sorrow. No ropes remain. How will your hull survive the crashing waves? The sails are torn, and the divine statue has vanished.— Beware. Do not let the storm toy with you.

text: Use the Shrine of Prayers to enhance prayers
Repair the path ahead through the power of time
Shatter the Chrono Vessel. Rewind the collapsed path
Shatter the Chrono Vessel. Rewind the broken "Chalice of Plenty"
